messages.messageBody:

WebElements aims to be a high quality source of information on the WWW about
the periodic table for all from students at school to professional
scientists.
http://www.webelements.com/

Added march 19 (mon)

http://www.loc.gov (Library of Congress)

http://www.home-school.com (Homeschool World)


http://www.schoolexpress.com

http://www.inhomeeducators.org (Indiana Assoc of Home Educators)

http://www.rainbowresource.com (for curriculum)

http://www.bigchalk.com

http://www.theteacherscorner.net

http://www.scholastic.com

http://www.weeklyreader.com

http://www.educationplace.com


http://www.janbrett.com/activities_pages_projects.htm

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Games online for kids?
messages.msgSnippet: ... There s a cool one called Escape from Knab. It very sneakily gets them doing math, because they have to figure out their budget on this other planet.
messages.messageBody:
--- Tracy Oldfield <tracy.oldfield@...>
wrote:
> What are everyone's favorite sites for their kids to
>
There's a cool one called Escape from Knab. It very
sneakily gets them doing math, because they have to
figure out their budget on this other planet.
www.escapefromknab.com Juli

=====
You cannot teach a man anything; you can only help him to find it within himself --Galileo

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Games online for kids?
messages.msgSnippet: Mine like to go to pogo.com and play either popit or sweet tooth those are both just stratagy games but pretty fun I love them! they also play bingo there  you
messages.messageBody:
Mine like to go to pogo.com and play either popit or sweet tooth those are both just stratagy games but pretty fun I love them! they also play bingo there  you win points for playing and then you use the points to buy tickets for a drawing for money.
its fun anyway!
Tanya

 
>>>>What are everyone's favorite sites for their kids to play online games.
My kids are young...oldest is 8.   Just thought there might be some
interesting, fun educational places to go.
Any ideas?
Thanks,
Ann

From: A [mailto:hooperck@...]
Sent: Saturday, April 21, 2001 7:34 PM
To: Unschooling
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Games online for kids?


What are everyone's favorite sites for their kids to play online games.
My kids are young...oldest is 8. Just thought there might be some
interesting, fun educational places to go.
Any ideas?
Thanks,
Ann

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Games online for kids?
messages.msgSnippet: My 10 year old loves Zoog Disney at www.zoogdisney.com We also play a lot of the classic games at pogo.com like backgammon, checkers, chess, spades, hearts,
messages.messageBody:
My 10 year old loves Zoog Disney at www.zoogdisney.com

We also play a lot of the classic games at pogo.com like
backgammon, checkers, chess, spades, hearts, word find games,
etc.

Judie
